sentence.Network_en: Clifford's only stipulation is that his clients obey his advice.
sentence.Network_cn: 克利福德唯一的要求就是客户必须听从他的建议。

sentence.Network_en: There's no stipulation as to the amount you can invest.
sentence.Network_cn: 没有关于投资额的规定.

sentence.Network_en: The only stipulation the building society makes is that house must be insured.
sentence.Network_cn: 建屋互助会作出的唯一规定是房屋必须保险.

China's law stipulates that prisoners who really show repentance and have rendered meritorious service can , upon rulings of the people's courts , have their sentences commuted or be on parole .中国法律规定，对确有悔改和立功表现的罪犯，经人民法院裁定分别给予减刑、假释。
规定一轮（Stipulated Round）包括除非经委员会特别决定，应按照球场正常球洞顺序打球。规定一轮的洞数是18洞，如少于该数目应 …

entry.def: If you stipulate a condition or stipulate that something must be done, you say clearly that it must be done.

example.ex: She could have stipulated that she would pay when she collected the computer...
example.tran: 她本可以要求她来取电脑时付钱。

example.ex: International rules stipulate the number of foreign entrants.
example.tran: 国际规则规定了外国参赛者的人数。

means.word_mean: 1. (law) an agreement or concession made by parties in a judicial proceeding (or by their attorneys) relating to the business before the court; must be in writing unless they are part of the court record;

sentences.sentence: "a stipulation of fact was made in order to avoid delay"

means.word_mean: 2. an assumption on which rests the validity or effect of something else
3. a restriction that is insisted upon as a condition for an agreement

sentences.en: He left all his money to the town with the stipulation that it should be used to build a new football stadium.
sentences.cn: 他把所有的钱都留给了该镇，条件是必须用这些钱来建一个新足球场。

sentences.en: The only stipulation the building society makes is that house must be insured.
sentences.cn: 建屋互助会作出的唯一规定是房屋必须保险。

sentences.en: There’s no stipulation as to the amount you can invest.
sentences.cn: 没有关于投资额的规定。
